the process of fitting shapes together in a pattern with no spaces in between, or an arrangement of shapes that has been made in this way: His tessellation technique resembles mosaic. A design of interlocking crosses is one of several tessellations on the floor of the cathedral. See

A mosaic in digital imaging is a plurality of non-overlapping images, arranged in some tessellation .Tessellation is a geometric division of a plane, a technique usually used in mosaics and tile work.This lively American site provides online lessons on many themes, such as tessellations, angles of polygons and Pythagorean identities.
